message: seems like a good place for the community to gather around some best practices/conventions, I'd rather delete forms.py and admin.py if not needed in exchange for learning that those are good places to put that code (for example)
have people posted some good starting points in terms of paster scripts etc that build out better or more complete starter directory structures
I have one for apps that sets up a full dist folder layout, with docs, readme, setup.py etc.  But it is sort of primitive and I'm sure someone has done a better job
pinax provides some of this, the last time I looked at it basic_project was a slightly more modern version of startproject

(I think with "starter projects" there's an inherent tradeoff between useful and generic. The more specific bits I stick in that _I_ almost always need for the types of projects I do, the less likely it is that someone else will find it matches their use cases.)
I do this internally, but haven't really tried to clean it up for public use. It's not very generic, it's highly opinionated.
my current solution involves renaming a number of placeholders by hand
on the app side, seems like the easier it is to make an app well packaged and shareable, the more the community wins
with that, i am off to bed for my flight in the morning. see everyone at PyCon (hopefully everyone) :-)

@ericflo in Pinax 0.9 (our development release) zero_project is the sweet spot IMO. it is a normal Django project with staticfiles and debug_toolbar. see it at https://github.com/pinax/pinax/tree/master/pinax/projects/zero_project
we've been rebasing every other project on its parents. so it goes zero > account > basic > social (basically)
@brosner Boom.
Exactly what I was thinking of, I knew Pinax had something for that.
With LFS and LFC we are using zc.buildout: https://bitbucket.org/hoehne/lfs-buildout-development/src/381dc0dc59ac/buildout.cfg

Not sure if this is what you're after but we have a project bootstrapper we use for new projects: https://github.com/lincolnloop/django-startproject  Charles Leifer also has a similar project that looks nice: https://github.com/coleifer/django-site-gen
It can create startproject, with database, serverconfig and more more.
Im use my tool: http://packages.python.org/makesite/
http://packages.python.org/makesite/modules.html#django
surprised not more out there for scaffolding a distributable, reusable app, with setup.py, docs, README, LICENSE, etc
I think django-command-extensions provides a means of copying from a template directory:  http://code.google.com/p/django-command-extensions/wiki/CommandExtensions
